translated: Jātaka
Twenty-Nipāta
Mātaṅgavagga
Ayogharajātaka (The Iron House)

analyzed: gabbhe vasati māṇavaḥ  abbhuṭṭhitaḥ iva saḥ yāti
translated: “The young man who first dwells in the womb for one night🔽rises up and goes,
he does not return to the place he came from.

original: Na yujjhamānā na balenavassitā,🔽Narā na jīranti na cāpi miyyare;
analyzed: na yujjhamānā na  narāḥ na jīranti na ca api miyyare
translated: Not by fighting, not by force, not by power,🔽men do not grow old or die;

analyzed: sabbam hi idam jāti jarāyu padduta
translated: all this is afflicted by birth, old age, and death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: that is my thought, I live by Dhamma.
The four-fold army, well-provisioned and well-equipped,
the rulers of the country conquer by force;
they are not able to conquer Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Hatthīhi assehi rathehi pattibhi,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  hatthīhi assehi rathehi pattibhi
translated: that is my thought, I live by Dhamma.
Some are surrounded by elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry,
they are set free, but are not able to escape from Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Hatthīhi assehi rathehi pattibhi,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  hatthīhi assehi rathehi pattibhi
translated: that is my thought, I live by Dhamma.🔽With elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry,
the heroes break through and destroy,
but are not able to break through Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: that is my thought, I live by Dhamma.
Elephants are intoxicated, their jawbones are broken, they are destroyed,
They madden the cities, they kill the people,
But they cannot madden the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Issāsino katahatthāpi vīrā,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  issāsinaḥ kata hatthā api vīrā
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.🔽Even the heroes who are skilled in archery,
Who are long-distance shooters and can hit the mark,
They cannot shoot the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Sarāni khīyanti saselakānanā,🔽Sabbaṁ hidaṁ khīyati dīghamantaraṁ;
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  sarāni khīyanti sa sela kānanā  sabbam hi dam khīyati dīgham antara
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.🔽The snares are destroyed, the forest with its deer,🔽All this will be destroyed after a long time;

analyzed: sabbam hi dam bhañjare kāla pariyāya
translated: All this will be broken up, in the course of time,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.

original: Sabbesa mevaṁ hi narāna nārinaṁ,🔽Calācalaṁ pāṇabhunodha jīvitaṁ;
translated: For all men and women,🔽Life is fleeting, like a drop of water on a lotus leaf,

analyzed: paṭaḥ uva dhuttassa dumaḥ uva kūla jaḥ
translated: Like a thief on a watchtower, like a tree on a river bank,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Dumapphalāneva patanti māṇavā,🔽Daharā ca vuddhā ca sarīrabhedā;
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  patanti māṇavā  daharā ca vuddhā ca sarīra bhedā
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.🔽Young men and old, in the breaking up of the body,🔽Women, men, and those of middle age,
Like fruits falling from a tree,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Nāyaṁ vayo tārakarājasannibho,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  na ayam tāraka rāja sannibhaḥ
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.🔽This age, which is like the king of the stars,
What has passed is gone, it will not come again,

original: Jiṇṇassa hī natthi ratī kuto sukhaṁ,
translated: For one who is old there is no pleasure, how can there be happiness?

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Yakkhas, ghosts, or even spirits,
Angry, they breathe on humans;
They cannot breathe on the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Yakkhas, ghosts, or even spirits,
Even when angry they can be appeased;
They cannot appease the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Aparādhake dūsake heṭhake ca,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  aparādhake dūsake heṭhake ca
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Kings, having found out the fault, punish those who have offended, those who have done wrong, and those who have been harmful;
They cannot punish the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Those who have offended, done wrong, and been harmful,
They can be appeased by the King;
They cannot appease the one who is dead,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.

analyzed: na khattiyā iti na ca brāhmaṇā iti
translated: Not because of being a noble, or a brāhmaṇa,
Or being powerful, strong, or brilliant;
There is no hope for the King of Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: That is my thought, I live by the Dhamma.

original: Sīhā ca byagghā ca athopi dīpiyo,
translated: Lions, tigers, and leopards,
Having killed, devour the struggling (prey);
They cannot devour Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: Therefore I have this thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Magicians in the middle of the arena,
Deceive the eyes of the people for a while;
They cannot deceive Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: Therefore I have this thought, I live by the Dhamma.
Angry snakes with raised crests,
They bite and kill those people;
They cannot bite Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: Therefore I have this thought, I live by the Dhamma.
The angry snakes that bite,
The doctors can cure their poison;

original: Na maccuno daṭṭhavisaṁ hananti,🔽Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: na maccunaḥ daṭṭha visam hananti  tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: They cannot cure the bite of Death,🔽Therefore I have this thought, I live by the Dhamma.
The snake-charmer, the bridge-builder, the feeder,
Having killed the snakes, the vipers;
They too die in the same way,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.🔽Vijjādharā ghoramadhīyamānā,
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma  vijjādharā ghoram adhīyamānā
translated: Therefore I have this thought, I live by the Dhamma.🔽The sorcerers, being tormented by the terrible spell,
Disappear with the herbs;
I have no fear of seeing the King of Death,

original: Taṁ me matī hoti carāmi dhammaṁ.
analyzed: tam me matī hoti carāmi dhamma
translated: I have understanding, I live the Dhamma.
The Dhamma protects the one who lives by the Dhamma,
The Dhamma, when well-practiced, brings happiness;
This is the benefit of practicing the Dhamma,
The one who lives by the Dhamma does not go to a bad destination.
The Dhamma and the non-Dhamma,
Do not have the same result;
The non-Dhamma leads to hell,
The Dhamma leads to a good destination.
The Ayoghara Jātaka is the fourteenth.
The Vīsatinipāta is finished.
The summary:
Mātaṅga, Sambhūta, Sīvi, Sīriman,
Rohaṇa, Haṁsa, Sattigumba, Bhallātiya;
Somanassa, Campeyya, Brahma, Pañca,
Paṇḍita, Cirassa, and Ayoghara.
